abstract: The Irish airline Ryanair said Friday that it had pulled out of talks to buy 200 aircraft from Boeing, and would now trim its investment plans starting in 2011.
snippet: The Irish airline Ryanair said Friday that it had pulled out of talks to buy 200 aircraft from Boeing, and would now trim its investment plans starting in 2011.
lead_paragraph: PARIS  Ryanair Holdings, Europe’s largest budget airline by passengers, said on Friday that it planned to slow its breakneck expansion and begin returning some cash to shareholders, setting off a 6 percent gain in its share price.

headline.main: Ryanair Ends Boeing Talks, to Benefit of Shareholders
headline.print_headline: Ryanair Ends Boeing Talks, To Benefit of Shareholders
